title: Unit 1: Friends and Family - Student Handout
description: Complete student materials for a 120-minute beginner-level reading lesson focusing on reading comprehension, present tense of 'be', be + adjective structures, and vocabulary for describing people and families.
content:
Unit 1: Friends and Family

Reading Skills - Student Handout

Level: Beginner (A1) | Duration: 120 minutes

PART 1: PRE-READING ACTIVITIES

Activity 1: Warmer - Talk About Families

Instructions: Look at the pictures your teacher shows you. Work with your partner.

Discuss:

  • What do you see in the pictures?
  • Who are these people?
  • Do you have brothers or sisters?
  • Who is in your family?

Make notes here:

Words I hear: _______________________________________________

_______________________________________________

Activity 2: Prediction Task

Instructions: Look at the title and photos of the reading text. Do NOT read yet! Make predictions with your partner.

Discuss these questions:

  1. What are their names?
  2. Are they family or friends?
  3. Where are they from?
  4. What will the text tell us?

My predictions:

I think _____________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________

Activity 3: Important Vocabulary

Instructions: Learn these words before reading. Listen to your teacher and repeat.

WordMeaningExample Sentence
HelloA greeting we use when we meet someoneHello! My name is Sarah.
HiAn informal greeting (like Hello)Hi! How are you?
Nice to meet youWhat we say when we meet someone for the first timeNice to meet you, John!
FamilyParents, brothers, sisters, and other relativesI have a big family.
MotherFemale parent (Mum / Mom)My mother is very kind.
FatherMale parent (Dad)My father is from London.
BrotherMale sibling (boy with same parents)I have two brothers.
SisterFemale sibling (girl with same parents)My sister is 15 years old.
FriendA person you like and enjoy time withTom is my best friend.
NiceKind, pleasant, goodShe is a nice person.
YoungNot old, in early part of lifeMy brother is young. He is 5.
HappyFeeling good, pleased, joyfulI am happy today!
FriendlyKind and easy to talk toThey are very friendly people.
TallHaving great heightMy father is very tall.
FromShows where someone's home country isI'm from Italy.

Practice: Write the words in your language:

Mother = _____________ Father = _____________ Brother = _____________

Sister = _____________ Friend = _____________ Family = _____________

PART 2: WHILE READING ACTIVITIES

Reading Text: Meet My Family and Friends

Hello! My name is Maria

Hello! My name is Maria. I'm from Spain. I'm 22 years old. I'm a university student in Madrid. I'm happy because I love my studies!

I have a big family. My mother's name is Carmen. She is 48 years old. She is very kind and friendly. She is a teacher. My father's name is Pablo. He is 50 years old. He is tall and funny. He is a doctor.

I have two brothers and one sister. My brother Carlos is 25. He is married. His wife's name is Ana. She is very nice. My brother Luis is 18. He is young and friendly. He is a student. My sister Rosa is 15. She is tall and happy. She loves music.

I also have great friends. My best friend is Laura. She is from Barcelona. She is 22 years old, like me. Laura is kind and funny. She is also a university student. We are very good friends!

Hi! I'm John

Hi! I'm John. I'm from England. I'm 28 years old. I'm from a small town near London, but now I live in Manchester. I'm a teacher. I love my job!

My family is small. My mother is Sarah. She is 55 years old. She is kind and friendly. She is a nurse. My father is Peter. He is 57 years old. He is tall and very funny! He is a manager in a big company.

I have one sister. Her name is Emma. She is 24 years old. She is married. Her husband is Mark. He is 26. Emma and Mark are very happy. They live in London. Emma is a doctor. She is very busy, but she is happy with her work.

I have many friends. My best friend is Tom. Tom is from Scotland. He is 29 years old. Tom is very tall and friendly. He is funny, too! We are friends from university. Tom is a computer programmer. We meet every weekend. We are like brothers!

My family and friends are very important to me. I'm happy when I'm with them!

Activity 4: Reading for Gist

Instructions: Read the text quickly (you have 4 minutes). Don't worry about every word. Answer these questions:

  1. How many people write in the text? __________
  2. What are their names? __________________ and __________________
  3. What is the text about? (Choose one)
    • ☐ Their jobs
    • ☐ Their families and friends
    • ☐ Their schools
    • ☐ Their hobbies

Check your predictions: Were your predictions correct? Yes / No

What was correct? _____________________________________________

Activity 6: Reading for Detail

Instructions: Read the text carefully. Answer these questions with complete information:

IELTS-STYLE QUESTIONS

SECTION A: Multiple Choice

Choose the correct letter, A, B, C, or D.

1. Maria's father Pablo is:

A) a teacher and kind
B) a doctor and tall
C) a student and young
D) a nurse and friendly

Your answer: _______

2. John lives in:

A) London
B) a small town near London
C) Manchester
D) Scotland

Your answer: _______

3. Who is married?

A) Maria and Laura
B) Carlos and Emma
C) Luis and Rosa
D) John and Tom

Your answer: _______

SECTION B: True / False / Not Given

Read the statements below. Write TRUE, FALSE, or NOT GIVEN:

StatementYour Answer
4. Maria has three brothers._______
5. Laura is Maria's best friend._______
6. John's sister Emma lives in Manchester._______
7. Tom is a teacher._______
8. Maria's mother Carmen is 50 years old._______

SECTION C: Sentence Completion

Complete the sentences below. Use NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS from the passage for each answer.

9. Maria is happy because she loves her _________________.

10. John's father Peter works as a _________________ in a big company.

11. Emma is very _________________, but she is happy with her work.

12. Tom and John meet every _________________.

13. Rosa is tall and happy. She loves _________________.

SECTION D: Short Answer Questions

Answer the questions below. Write NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS for each answer.

14. Where is Laura from? _____________________________

15. What is Carlos's wife's name? _____________________________

16. How old is John's mother? _____________________________

17. Who does John say is like a brother to him? _____________________________
